"Herb is the thing that brings me together. You know? It de-stresses my mind [and allows me to] be more focused and have direction. It allows a person to kinda—like my father said—'remove oneself from Babylon.' Right? To go above the stratosphere and look from the outside in. To take oneself to a quiet place and bring your mind together, so you can focus. Herb is vision." – Rohan Marley
.

Marley Natural & Stephen Marley's daughter Shacia join forces with local residents for a beach clean-up in Malibu, CA! As Shacia reflects, "To sum up what the beach means to me in one word, I'd say home—it’s where we spend a lot of time together as a family. It’s where we go to reflect, to meditate, to get centered." 
.
Know a beach that needs help in your town? Post your suggestions for their next project in the comments below. BLESS Marley Natural beach clean-up with Shachia Marley! (Malibu, CA)

Through their social mission, Marley Natural supports Oracabessa Bay Fish Sanctuary in St. Mary. They find it absolutely vital to work alongside fishermen to sustain the oceanic environment. This allows for equal growth of the coral reefs while sustainably providing for the community. 

Find out how you can support by visiting marleynaturalshop.com/riseup Timeline Photos

#MARLEYFACT: When the Wailers first started selling their music through Coxsone Dodd's Studio One label, they were only making 3 pounds a week.

Because of this, Bob moved to Wilmington, Delaware to live with his mother and make some money. He first worked at the Hotel duPont vacuuming floors, and then for Chrysler as a forklift operator. With the money he made, he returned to Kingston and formed Tuff Gong Records. Timeline Photos

Today in 1976, amidst the violent turmoil between Jamaica's opposing political parties, an assassination attempt was made on Bob's life while rehearsing at 56 Hope Road for the #SmileJamaica concert. Marley was shot in the arm, his wife & bandmate RitaMarley was shot in the head, and manager Don Taylor was shot several times in the stomach. Miraculously, all survived the horrific event, and in a showing of great ideological fortitude and bravery, Bob Marley & The Wailers would go on to perform at the festival as scheduled, just two days later. #todayinbobslife Timeline Photos

#TodayInBobsLife: On December 3, 1976, an assassination attempt was made on Bob’s life.  

The incident came two days before the now-infamous ‘Smile Jamaica,' a free concert Bob agreed to play in the hopes of quelling tensions between Jamaica’s rivaling political parties.  While Marley and The Wailers were rehearsing at his 56 Hope Road residence, an unnamed gunman shot and wounded RitaMarley, manager Don Taylor, and Bob, who was grazed in the chest by a ricocheted bullet that ended up in his elbow; miraculously, no one was killed.  Despite everything, Marley performed as planned, and the incident became his inspiration for “Ambush In The Night.”  

Let us take a moment today to honor both the mental and physical fortitude of the Legend, who heroically risked his life in the pursuit of peace. Timeline Photos
